justification: “For this rating of overall value, participants responded to the question, 'Do you like this snack?' using a horizontal slider scale… The leftmost end of the scale was labeled 'HATE,' and the rightmost end was labeled 'LOVE'. The … response was captured … ranging from 1 to 100.”

measured_by: horizontal slider scale labeled “Not at all!” to “Absolutely!”
justification: “All participants then responded to the question, 'How sure are you about your choice?' using a horizontal slider scale. The leftmost end of the scale was labeled 'Not at all!' and the rightmost end was labeled 'Absolutely!'”

measured_by: SoA metric (change in ratings of chosen minus unchosen options from pre- to post-choice)
justification: “SoA is defined as the change in rating for the chosen option (from initial to final rating) minus the change in rating for the unchosen option.”

measured_by: absolute pre-choice value difference |dV1| between options
justification: “We define difficulty according to the difference in initial value ratings between the options (dV1), where higher values of |dV1| imply lower choice difficulty.”
